answers.answer: We tried about a year. When I was tired of trying "for now" we finally conceived.  I have PCOS

We tried for 2 months both pregnancies gave up and conceived on the 3rd. I'm very impatient lol but I'd say trying was stressing me out so deciding to just let it be was less stressful and well and be hold it was the next month. Maybe a coincidence, I don't know :)
It took us 12 months to conceive. So far a healthy pregnancy :)

We tried for jusy over 4 years I have severe pcos. Found out we was pregnant the day before seeing the fertility specialist.Unfortunatly we lost our little boy due to ic in the april. We got the go ahead on july 27th to try again and conceived in the august. I was shocked expecting to wait a long time again.
We decided and on same night I got preg wiv my second set of twins I am 27 weeks 2 days today was a shock I can tell u we was hopin for a bit if funfirst lol

I am 27 weeks pregnant as of last friday, and I have been sick for about a week and a half now. I've been coughing non stop and the excessive coughing has caused a strain in my back. I can barely walk. I've been to the hospital but they wouldn't give me a cough suppressant, I need some kind of remedy because the coughing needs to cease. Please help.

I am 27 weeks pregnant as of last friday, and I have been sick for about a week and a half now. I've been coughing non stop and the excessive coughing has caused a strain in my back. I can barely walk. I've been to the hospital but they wouldn't give me a cough suppressant, I need some kind of remedy because the coughing needs to cease. Please help.

I am now 36 weeks + 3 days. We've been trying for over 3 years. I've been diagnosed with PCOS and insuline resistance, sent to the fertility clinic, tried all kinds of treatments - nothing worked. Then I stopped all treatments because they made me feel horrible most of the times and we completely changed our life style, we both lost significantly a lot of weight (weren't obese before, just overweight) and started doing regular ovulation tests. After another 6 months when we were already sure we'll never make it I got a positive result on the home test. I've had an absolutely easy pregnancy so far, except for excessive tests and ultrasounds and panic attacks thanks to my doctors (who are overly cautious with my pregnancy - they were sure I won't succeed without IVF) - they were sure I'll have complications like gestational diabetes, preeclampsia etc. At 31 weeks I was almost admitted to the hospital to induce the labor - but finally all tests came back perfect.
I tried for over 20 years. I'm 43 years old and finally pregnant. I'm almost 19 weeks. We're having a boy in May!

If you have one try taken an in haler or breathing treatment. Also you are aloud to take robitussion just make sure on the bottle is says no alchol. That helps lovely also. Or you can try hot tea mixed with lemon and honey sounds off but trust me it does its magic. I was like that for servel weeks when I was around 13 14 weeks and it was the worse feeling I'd get tothe point where I'd cough so much it would lead to throwing up. But if you have more then one hospital in your area try going to a different hospital because that's what I had to do. I just keep gling back and forth and Finally I found a Dr who was way more caring about pregnant women then others he tried and ran every test he could to figure out was wrong. And then finally prescribed me a cough medicine codiene. Just keep trying to get better don't settle for a no answer or no help from a doctor.

It took me 10 years to get pregnant with my twins (years of infertility injections etc) had two miscarriages before I had them. They just turned three.  Early last year I got.pregnant on my own total shock then had another miscarriage and got pregnant again now 24+2 with a little girl
2 years with first, she was stillborn. 3 years with second. 2 years with third, miscarriage. 1 year with this one. I used clomid for all four.
It took me 2 years for my first. 3 years for my second who will be 16 months when baby number 3 arrives.

I was actually told that I have 2 blood clotting deficiencies so I have to (Now that I'm pregnant) take a lovenox shot every night so my baby doesn't get a blood clot on the feeding tube, or elsewhere. Due to that I was told it may be harder to concieve, but it turns out I was pregnant while talking to my OB that day, ah the irony to it! We were trying for maybe 3 months, perhaps 4

question: Hi ladies! How long did it take you to conceive? How long were you trying till it finally happened? I have endometriosis (went for an operation for it a few months ago) and wondered if that could affect my chances of conceiving and time it will take to conceive...
title: Trying time
